newsitem.title: BOLIVIA: SOCCER-HERNANDEZ SCORES SIXTH GOAL IN MEXICO WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HERNANDEZ SCORES SIXTH GOAL IN MEXICO WIN.

text.p: Luis Hernandez scored his sixth goal of the Copa America as Mexico beat Peru 1-0 in the third place play-off on Saturday.
Hernandez settled the game with an 81st minute header which also put him two goals clear of Brazil's Ronaldo as the competition's top goalscorer.

His goal apart, the game was as featureless as the high altitude desert that surrounds the mining town of Oruro. Neither team seemed remotely interested in exerting themselves in a match played at 3,700 metres above sea level.

Peru, who brought an under-23 team to the Copa to rest their top players for the World Cup qualifiers, had finished their semi-final in Santa Cruz, which is just above sea level, less than 48 hours before.
Brazil meet Bolivia in Sunday's final in La Paz.
